entries.title: Prosecutors to investigate US Congressman-elect over false claims
entries.description: The recently elected Republican representative fabricated key info about his employment, education and family history.

entries.title: Suspect in US attack on Nancy Pelosi’s husband pleads not guilty
entries.description: David DePape reportedly told police he planned to break the US House Speaker's kneecaps but found her husband instead.

entries.title: Bolivian police arrest prominent opposition leader
entries.description: Governor of the Santa Cruz region, Luis Fernando Camacho, was detained following weeks of protests in the region.

entries.title: US to require negative COVID tests for travellers from China
entries.description: Restrictions come in response to surge of infections across China after Beijing lifted strict policies to contain virus.

entries.title: Little prospect of peace as Ukraine war reaches 10-month mark
entries.description: Putin signals willingness for peace but makes clear he means peace on Russia's terms.

entries.title: Photos: Upstate NY cleans up from storm as travel chaos ensues
entries.description: A storm driven by an Arctic blast brought freezing temperatures as far south as the Mexican border, leaving many dead.

entries.title: Uzbekistan says 18 children die after consuming India-made syrup
entries.description: Incident follows deaths of at least 70 children in The Gambia after they took cough and cold syrups made by Indian firm.

entries.title: Brazil’s top court bans guns from capital for tense inauguration
entries.description: Some supporters of outgoing far-right President Jair Bolsonaro have called for a coup to prevent a transition of power.

entries.title: ‘System failure’: US blames Southwest Airlines for meltdown
entries.description: US Secretary of Transportation Pete Buttigeig says mass flight cancellations are not merely a 'weather-driven issue'.

entries.title: Ivory Coast hands down 11 life sentences in 2016 resort attack
entries.description: The men were convicted of abetting an armed group's attack on a beach resort that killed 19 people in Grand-Bassam.

entries.title: Is West’s opposition to rule by Venezuela’s Maduro fragmenting?
entries.description: Opposition rejects the Western choice for president, Juan Guaido, leaving Nicolas Maduro firmly in power.

entries.title: US militia member sentenced to 19 years in kidnapping plot
entries.description: Prosecutors had sought a life sentence for Barry Croft Jr for his involvement in a plot to kidnap the Michigan governor.

entries.title: US marks four year anniversary of Paul Whelan detention in Russia
entries.description: The former US marine is serving a 16-year sentence for alleged espionage, though his family maintains his innocence.

entries.title: Understanding the surge in migration at the US-Mexico border
entries.description: Rising number of migrant and refugee arrivals is problem decades in the making and made worse by US policy, experts say.

entries.title: Tears, prayers as flights resume to Ethiopia’s Tigray region
entries.description: A shutdown of flights and communications for much of the two-year conflict kept many Tigrayans away from their families.

entries.title: Turkey, Syria, Russia defence ministers hold talks in Moscow
entries.description: Sides agree to continue meeting in the future to ensure stability in Syria and the region as a whole, Ankara says.

entries.title: Photos: Spain festival revellers hurl flour, eggs in mock coup
entries.description: Revellers dressed in mock military garb take part in Els Enfarinats food-battle in the southern Spanish town of Ibi.

entries.title: Bosnia nominates first female Croat PM-designate
entries.description: Borjana Kristo is set to form a coalition government that will seek to look past ethnic divides.

entries.title: Depriving Afghan women of an education would benefit no one
entries.description: The Taliban's anti-education edicts stand against the very foundations of Islam and will harm Afghan society as a whole.

entries.title: Bangladesh opens first metro line to ease Dhaka’s traffic
entries.description: The country plans to extend the train network to more than 100 stations and six lines across the capital by 2030.

entries.title: Italy summons Iran’s envoy to Rome over crackdown on protesters
entries.description: Italy's foreign minister express Rome's 'indignation and worry' over Tehran's crackdown on anti-government protests.

entries.title: The coming battle for the racist vote in America
entries.description: A sitting governor and a former president are facing off in a white supremacist race for power.

entries.title: At least seven people killed as car rams into carnival in Nigeria
entries.description: Dozens also injured when driver 'loses control' of vehicle and smashes into crowd in southeastern port city of Calabar.

entries.title: 2022 review: Visualising how the Russia-Ukraine war unfolded
entries.description: Al Jazeera looks at how the conflict unfolded on the ground, the human costs of 10 months of war and the global response

entries.title: Pakistani film to release in India after 11 years amid blowback
entries.description: The Legend of Maula Jatt, which broke Pakistan's box office records this year, is set to release on December 30.

entries.title: The stories that changed Latin America in 2022
entries.description: The past year saw a political swing leftward in countries like Brazil and Colombia as well as crises and World Cup gold.

entries.title: After Sudan deals, dissenters say military has silenced them
entries.description: A series of reconciliation deals have sought to end the fighting in Darfur, but opponents say they do not go far enough.

entries.title: Spain appoints new ambassador to Venezuela as relations thaw
entries.description: Madrid sends new envoy to Caracas after a two year-hiatus over controversial 2018 presidential election.

entries.title: Netanyahu gov’t says West Bank settlement expansion top priority
entries.description: Israel's incoming far-right government made the announcement a day before it is set to be sworn into office.

entries.title: What are the ‘atmospheric rivers’ hitting the US West Coast?
entries.description: Huge 'atmospheric rivers' have resulted in torrential downpours, high winds and flood watches.

entries.title: Kosovo shuts main border crossing with Serbia amid protests
entries.description: Pristina closure of the Merdare crossing on Kosovo's eastern border comes as tensions with its Balkans neighbour spiral.

entries.title: Pope Francis asks for prayers for ‘very sick’ ex-pope Benedict
entries.description: Pope Benedict XVI of the Roman Catholic Church resigned in 2013 due to advancing age.

entries.title: UAE firms scramble to hire locals for jobs as deadline approaches
entries.description: Private sector firms will have to ensure that 2 percent of their staff are Emiratis by January 1 or face fines.

entries.title: No energy worries for Italy’s ‘Tribe of the Harmonious Walnuts’
entries.description: Fabrizio Cardinali, aged 72, has lived entirely off the grid for more than half a century.

entries.title: In South Africa, ransom kidnappings are on the rise
entries.description: Experts say the phenomenon is relatively new in South Africa but has been experiencing explosive growth since 2016.

entries.title: South Korea unveils $440m plan to counter North’s drone invasions
entries.description: President Yoon Suk-yeol looks to boost confidence in the military's ability to counter drones after Monday's incursion.

entries.title: Angola court orders dos Santos’s assets seized: Portuguese agency
entries.description: In November, global police agency Interpol issued a red notice for dos Santos, formerly Africa's richest woman.

entries.title: Australia to hold referendum on Indigenous ‘Voice’ next year
entries.description: If approved, the constitution will be changed to have Indigenous people permanently represented in government.

entries.title: Australian killed fighting Russia in Ukraine, says government
entries.description: Sage O'Donnell, from Victoria, is at least the fourth Australian to die in the war in Ukraine.

entries.title: What is Zelenskyy’s 10-point peace plan?
entries.description: The Ukrainian president has been promoting his formula for peace to US President Biden and other leaders.

entries.title: Crypto player Kraken to exit Japan amid sector’s annus horribilis
entries.description: US-based cryptocurrency exchange's announcement comes amid plummeting asset values and sector-wide reckoning over FTX.

entries.title: Russian troops sent to Ukraine entitled to sperm freezing: TASS
entries.description: Russia’s health ministry will provide financial support for sperm freezing to soldiers sent to fight in Ukraine.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 308
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 308th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Afghan women on NGO work ban: ‘My heart will burst from the pain’
entries.description: Alia, an Afghan mental health professional, said the Taliban's ban on women working with NGOs hurts the vulnerable.

entries.title: US weighs restrictions for Chinese travellers amid COVID surge
entries.description: US officials express concern over lack of transparency about China's rising COVID cases.

entries.title: From China to inflation, 5 economic trends to watch in 2023
entries.description: The global economy is facing risks and opportunities next year from rising interest rates to China's reopening.

entries.title: Kosovo minister sees Russian influence in growing Serbian tension
entries.description: Interior Minister Xhelal Svecla accused Belgrade of supporting Serbian protesters as a means to destabilise Kosovo.

entries.title: N Korea’s Kim sets new military goals for 2023 at party meeting
entries.description: Kim Jong Un's remarks may mean he will continue to conduct tests and expand military capabilities in the coming year.

entries.title: US judge denies request to sanction Republican governor candidate
entries.description: Arizona Governor-elect Katie Hobbs sought sanctions against Republican rival Kari Lake over allegations of voter fraud.
